dbdiffchecker

Class MySQLConn

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbdiffchecker.MySQLConn

  • public class MySQLConn
extends java.lang.Object
    MySQLConn establishes a connection with a MySQL database based on the password, username, port, host, and database provided.
    Since:
    9-6-17

      Constructor and Description
      MySQLConn(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String host, java.lang.String port, java.lang.String database, java.lang.String type)
      Initializes a DB_conn object by setting the instance variables and testing the database connection to make sure that the database can be reached.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MySQLConn

        public MySQLConn(java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 java.lang.String host,
                 java.lang.String port,
                 java.lang.String database,
                 java.lang.String type)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Initializes a DB_conn object by setting the instance variables and testing the database connection to make sure that the database can be reached.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the MySQL account.
        password - The password of the MySQL account.
        host - The host of the MySQL account.
        port - The port MySQL is running on.
        database - The database in MySQL that the connection is to be established with.
        type - Is to either dev or live.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - The database could not be connected to using the provided information.

    • Method Detail

      • establishDatabaseConnection

        public void establishDatabaseConnection()
                                 throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        Makes a connection with the database using the information from this object's constructor.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException - Error when connecting to the database.
        See Also:
        https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e3gnhsGqNmI

      • getTableCreateStatement

        public java.lang.String getTableCreateStatement(java.lang.String table)
                                         throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        Gets and returns the create statement of the specified table.
        Parameters:
        table - The name of the table for which the create statement should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Table's create statement or an empty string if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException - Error when getting a table's create statement.

      • getViewCreateStatement

        public java.lang.String getViewCreateStatement(java.lang.String view)
                                        throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        Gets and returns the create statement of the desired table.
        Parameters:
        view - The name of the view for which the create statement should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The view's create statement.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException - Error when getting a view's create statement.

      • getTableList

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> getTableList()
                                                       throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        Gets the tables, columns, and indices of the database.
        Returns:
        The names of the tables and table data that exist in the database.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException - Error when getting a table data.

      • getViews

        public java.util.ArrayList<View> getViews()
                                   throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        Gets a list of views of that exist in the database.
        Returns:
        All of the views in the database.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException - Error when getting a view's data.

      • createIndexes

                             java.sql.ResultSet index)

        Takes in a ResultSet and a table object and adds all indexes found in the ResultSet to the table object.

        index - Contains the data to make a indexes for a specific table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - An error occurred while accessing an index property.

      • getDatabaseName

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseName()
        Returns the name of the database to connect to.
        Returns:
        The name of the database to connect to.

      • getFirstSteps

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFirstSteps()
        Returns the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements. These SQL statements are used to drop Primary Keys and remove auto_increments on the database provided. Note: this funntion will return an empty ArrayList if the function is called on the dev database.
        Returns:
        The first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements

      • closeDatabaseConnection

        public void closeDatabaseConnection()
                             throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        Closes the connection with the database.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException - Error when closing the connection to the database.
